alex.mojaki.boxes

Class BoxFamily

  • java.lang.Object
    • alex.mojaki.boxes.BoxFamily

  • public class BoxFamily
extends Object
    This class holds metadata for a group of PowerBoxes, including middleware and observers. Boxes which return the same value from PowerBox.getFamily() are said to belong to the same family and share all this metadata.

    Here is an example of declaring a box and its family: 

    
 class MyClass {
     public static final BoxFamily myFieldFamily = BoxFamily.getInstance(MyClass.class, "myField");
     PowerBox<Integer> myField = box(myFieldFamily);
 }

    This is equivalent to: 

    
     PowerBox<Integer> myField = box(MyClass.class, "myField");

    which is more concise but less efficient as the family has to be looked up.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BoxFamily.ParticipantList<E>
      A thread-safe, append-only list of observers/middleware.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static BoxFamily getInstance(Class<?> clazz,
                                    String name)
        Obtain an instance of BoxFamily identified by the given class and name. Repeated calls with the same arguments return the same instance.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class in which the boxes belonging to this family are declared. This can be obtained later by getDeclaringClass()
        name - the name of the boxes belonging to this family. This can be obtained later by getName()
        Returns:
        the unique instance with this class and name.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Return the name of the boxes belonging to this family.

      • getDeclaringClass

        public Class<?> getDeclaringClass()
        Return the class in which the boxes belonging to this family are declared.

      • addChangeMiddleware

        public BoxFamily addChangeMiddleware(ChangeMiddleware... middlewares)
        Add ChangeMiddlewares which will be applied by boxes belonging to this family when PowerBox.set(Object) is called. Arguments equal to instances that have already been added will be ignored.
        Returns:
        this object for chaining

      • addGetMiddleware

        public BoxFamily addGetMiddleware(GetMiddleware... middlewares)
        Add GetMiddlewares which will be applied by boxes belonging to this family when PowerBox.get() is called. Arguments equal to instances that have already been added will be ignored.
        Returns:
        this object for chaining

      • addChangeObserver

        public BoxFamily addChangeObserver(ChangeObserver... observers)
        Add ChangeObservers which will be applied by boxes belonging to this family when the value of the box changes. Arguments equal to instances that have already been added will be ignored.
        Returns:
        this object for chaining

      • addGetObserver

        public BoxFamily addGetObserver(GetObserver... observers)
        Add GetObservers which will be applied by boxes belonging to this family when PowerBox.get() is called. Arguments equal to instances that have already been added will be ignored.
        Returns:
        this object for chaining

      • description

        public String description()
        A simple human readable description of the boxes belonging to this family, equal to:

        getDeclaringClass().getSimpleName() + "." + getName()

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • showsValueStrings

        public boolean showsValueStrings()
        Return whether boxes in this family should show the string representations of their values in toString() and in exception messages. By default this returns true. If hideValueStrings() has been called it returns false.

      • hideValueStrings

        public BoxFamily hideValueStrings()
        Prevent boxes in this family from showing the string representations of their values in toString() and in exception messages. This is to avoid leaking sensitive data in logs or computing expensive string representations. It is still possible to explicitly obtain the string representation if desired.
        See Also:
        showsValueStrings(), AbstractPowerBox.toString(), WrapperBox.revealedToString()

      • notNull

        public BoxFamily notNull()
        Convenience method equivalent to addChangeObserver(ThrowOnNull.INSTANCE).
        Returns:
        this object for chaining
